bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Dorothea Dix was an activist for the indigent mentally ill. Her lobbying efforts resulted in the creation of several American mental asylums, including Dix Hill Asylum in Raleigh, N.C., later renamed Dorothea Dix Hospital. During the Civil War, Dix served as a Superintendent of Army Nurses.
